intro: Gymnosporia esquirolii, commonly known as the Esquiroli's gymnosporia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rhamnaceae. It is characterized by its spiny stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a rough texture. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are woody capsules that contain minute, wind-dispersed seeds. Gymnosporia esquirolii is typically found in arid or semi-arid regions, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
